alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 3:40AM EST until March 04 at 9:24PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Stark County, including Nimishillen Creek and the West Branch of Nimishillen Creek. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 AM EST, Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Rain has ended but rainfall amounts up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Locations along and near the West Branch of the Nimishillen Creek in Canton should be flooding with recent gauge readings along the creek above 13 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, North Canton, Louisville, Hartville, East Sparta, Meyers Lake, Hills And Dales and Perry Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
